title: Ronald Koeman fires warning to contract rebel Romelu Lukaku over his Everton future
text:

Ronald Koeman has told contract rebel Romelu Lukaku that Everton will decide when he leaves Goodison. 
The Premier League's top goalscorer rocked Blues chiefs when he told them he WON'T sign a new deal, just minutes after top brass had expressed their confidence he would put pen to paper imminently. 
Lukaku , who has been linked with Manchester United , suggested he has refused to extend his current deal because of a lack of ambition from the Blues, and their inability to sign top quality players this season. 
Koeman has hit back by suggesting he will speak to his board about the possibility of disciplinary action against the striker after his outburst, and he also warned the much-admired forward that his refusal to sign sign a new deal, doesn't automatically mean he can leave in the summer. Lukaku and Barkley's futures remain uncertain (Photo: Everton FC) 
"First of all the deal wasn't agreed and 99.9 per cent is not 100 per cent - they are still trying to get the contract over the line and that is what I know from the board of the club," Koeman explained. 
"Everybody knows anything can happen in football but you have to respect your contract. 
"There is no problem, his behaviour except some quotes in this interview I like from the player and there is no need to put him out of the team. Rom scores goals and we like to keep the momentum, like to keep going." 
Asked how long talks could go on with Lukaku, the Dutch boss added: "There is no definite decision - because his contract is still two more years at Everton. Read More Five possible destinations for Romelu Lukaku as summer exit from Everton looms Ronald Koeman has issued a warning to his star striker (Photo: Everton FC via Getty) 
"Of course you don't like every day in the media talking about his contract, everybody knows there is no agreement but it is up to the board to get the deal done. 
"We play Saturday, and then it is the international break and after the international break the board will send a message about the situation with Romelu." 
One of those messages could be a fine for the player for speaking out about his contract, and questioning Everton's ambition. 
Asked if there could be disciplinary action, Koeman explained: "First you speak with the player, I will speak with the board and then we see what will happen. Read More Lukaku's agent Mino Raiola was spotted at the same Manchester hotel as United chief Ed Woodward (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Woodward leaves the Lowry on Thursday (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) 
"We have the international break and we have time then to see what we have to do. 
"Of course I am not happy about that interview, because first if EFC is not a club with a lot of ambition I wouldn't be the manager in Everton. 
"And the second is and I spoke with Rom this morning, I know it's difficult but if you are a player prepare yourself to play good to score goals. We know he's one of the best and the rest needs to be done by the manager and the board of the club."
